scenario_name: Model Inversion Attack on Customer Churn Prediction
description: A malicious actor attempts to reconstruct sensitive customer data from a deployed customer churn prediction model.  The attacker uses a model inversion attack to infer protected attributes like income and location by carefully crafting inputs and observing the model's outputs. This aims to violate customer privacy and potentially enable targeted phishing campaigns.
initial_goal: Assess the robustness of the customer churn prediction model against adversarial attacks.
enterprise_context: Investment/Consumer Banking: A large bank uses a machine learning model to predict customer churn probability based on various customer attributes.  The model is deployed as an API accessible to authorized personnel for risk assessment.
